edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class CometsParameters

java.lang.Object
  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.CometsParameters
All Implemented Interfaces:
CometsConstants
public class CometsParameters
extends java.lang.Object
implements CometsConstants

This implements a set of global parameters used throughout the COMETS program. Although none of these are static or anything, it is intended that only one CometsParameters object is instantiated for a given run of COMETS, then passed around to whatever classes need it.

Author:
Bill Riehl

Field Summary

CometsParameters

public CometsParameters()
Method Detail

getMaxSpaceBiomassConcentration

public double getMaxSpaceBiomassConcentration()
Returns:
the maximum allowed biomass concentration in any given grid space. Overflow should be handled by the World2D or Cell classes.

setMaxSpaceBiomassConcentration

public void setMaxSpaceBiomassConcentration(double max)
Sets the maximum allowed biomass concentration in any given space. Since we can't really have a negative concentration, if this value is less than zero, it is rounded up to zero.

Parameters:
max - - the maximum biomass concentration, must be >= 0

getBackgroundColor

public int getBackgroundColor()
Fetches the current background color of the world as a packed 32 bit integer. Ignoring the alpha channel, the red channel is the second pair of bytes, the green is the third pair, and the blue is the last pair.

These can be unraveled by doing something like:
r = bgcolor | bgcolor >> 16
g = bgcolor >> 8 & 0xFF;
b = bgcolor & 0xFF;
 This returns an int value used in the Processing implementation of the CometsRunPanel.

Returns:
an integer used for representing a color

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(int r,
                               int g,
                               int b)
Sets the background color to be a combination of three rgb channels. Each value is expected to be in the range of 0-255, and will be adjusted up or down as needed

Parameters:
r - - the value of the red channel
g - - the value of the green channel
b - - the value of the blue channel

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(int rgb)
Sets the background color to the three rgb channels packaged as a 32 bit integer. This is intended for use with the Processing package, so the first 2 bytes are the alpha channel (not used for background color), followed by the red, green, and blue channels, e.g. rgb = 0x00000000 | r << 16 | g << 8 | b;

Parameters:
rgb - - the integer value of the three rgb color channels

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color c)
Sets the background color to a standard Java Color.

Parameters:
c - - the color to set

getBarrierColor

public int getBarrierColor()
Returns the barrier color as a packaged 32 bit integer.

Returns:
an integer used for representing the barrier color
See Also:
getBackgroundColor()

setBarrierColor

public void setBarrierColor(int r,
                            int g,
                            int b)
Sets the barrier color using red, blue, and green channels, with values expected to be in the range of 0-255

Parameters:
r - - the value of the red channel
g - - the value of the green channel
b - - the value of the blue channel
See Also:
setBackgroundColor(int, int, int)

Sets the barrier color to the three rgb channels packed into a 32-bit integer.

Parameters:
rgb - - the integer value of the three packaged channels
See Also:
setBackgroundColor(int)

Parameters:
c - - the color to use for barriers

getDeathRate

public double getDeathRate()
Returns:
the death rate for all modeled cell types, as a decimal value between 0 and 1.
See Also:
setDeathRate(double)

setDeathRate

public void setDeathRate(double rate)
Sets the death rate for all modeled cell types, to be applied on each cycle. For example, if the death rate is 0.1, then 10% of the biomass will "die" (be removed) on each cycle. This is expected to be between 0 and 1, and will be either increased or decreased to fit that range.

Parameters:
rate - - a decimal value between 0 and 1

getSlideshowName

public java.lang.String getSlideshowName()
Returns the root name of the slideshow series.

Returns:
a String for the name of a slideshow
See Also:
setSlideshowName(String), saveSlideshow(boolean)

setSlideshowName

public void setSlideshowName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the root name of the slideshow that comes from running a Comets simulation. This string is the prefix of every image file made, followed by a number for each frame of the slideshow

Parameters:
name - - a String representing the root name of the slideshow

getSlideshowExt

public java.lang.String getSlideshowExt()
Returns the extension (image type) of the slideshow.

Returns:
a String containing the extension name of each slideshow image file.

setSlideshowExt

public void setSlideshowExt(java.lang.String ext)
Sets the extension (e.g. image type) of each slideshow image file to be saved. If it is an invalid format, this will automatically reset to saving .png files.

Parameters:
ext - - an image file extension.
See Also:
saveSlideshow(boolean)

getSlideshowRate

public int getSlideshowRate()
Returns the rate (in number of frames) at which a slideshow frame is captured using the given name and image format.

Returns:
an integer rate for saving the slideshow
See Also:
setSlideshowName(String), setSlideshowExt(String), saveSlideshow(boolean)

setSlideshowRate

public void setSlideshowRate(int rate)
Sets the rate (in number of frames) at which a slideshow frame is captured using the given name and image format. This value is expected to be at least 1 - if less than one, it will be adjusted up to 1.

Parameters:
rate - - an integer rate for saving the slideshow
See Also:
setSlideshowName(String), setSlideshowExt(String), saveSlideshow(boolean)

getMediaRespawnRate

public int getMediaRespawnRate()
Returns the rate at which the media is respawned as number of cycles. This value can also be CometsConstants.NEVER_RESPAWN.

Returns:
either a positive integer or CometsConstants.NEVER_RESPAWN

setMediaRespawnRate

public void setMediaRespawnRate(int rate)
Sets the rate at which media respawns in the world. This value can either be CometsContants.NEVER_RESPAWN or a positive integer. If the rate is a positive number, then it is used to count the number of cycles between media respawns in the world. For example, if rate = 1, then media is reloaded after every cycle, if rate = 2, then it's done every other cycle, and so on.

Parameters:
rate -

getDiffusionsPerStep

public int getDiffusionsPerStep()
Returns the number of diffusion steps performed on each simulation cycle.

Returns:
a positive integer
See Also:
setDiffusionsPerStep(int)

setDiffusionsPerStep

public void setDiffusionsPerStep(int count)
Sets the number of diffusion steps to be performed on each simulation cycle. This number has a lower limit of 1, and will be set to 1 if the passed value is less.

Each diffusion step is performed as explained elsewhere (TODO - add this, eh?). Multiple diffusion steps just push the diffusion closer to equilibrium at a single step.

Note that differs from the diffusion rate.

Parameters:
count -

getDiffusionRate

public double getDiffusionRate()
Returns the diffusion rate, a decimal value between 0 and 1. This value is used to scale what concentration diffuses from each space on every cycle. Note that this is different from the diffusion step

Returns:

setDiffusionRate

public void setDiffusionRate(double rate)
Sets the diffusion rate - a decimal value between 0 and 1. Any values outside this range will be adjusted to fit.

Parameters:
rate - - the rate of diffusion to and from each space on each cycle.

getMaxCycles

public int getMaxCycles()
Returns:
either the maximum number of cycles for the simulation or CometsConstants.UNLIMITED_CYCLES.

setMaxCycles

public void setMaxCycles(int max)
Sets the maximum number of cycles for the simulation. This value must be >= 1, or CometsConstants.UNLIMITED_CYCLES. If this is violated, the max number of cycles will be automatically set to 1.

Parameters:
max - - either an integer >= 1 or CometsConstants.UNLIMITED_CYCLES.

showText

public boolean showText()
A flag for whether or not to show text on the CometsRunPanel when different events occur.

Returns:
true if text is to be shown on various events.

showText

public void showText(boolean b)
Sets a boolean flag for showing text on the CometsRunPanel when various events occur. These include pausing/unpausing the simulation, toggling through viewing different metabolites or biomass, and adjusting the color scheme.

Parameters:
b -

Parameters:
b - - if true, writes a cell line log.

saveSlideshow

public boolean saveSlideshow()
Returns:
true if a slideshow will be saved.
See Also:
saveSlideshow(boolean)

saveSlideshow

public void saveSlideshow(boolean b)
Tells COMETS whether or not to save a slideshow. A slideshow is a series of images representing the changes that occur to biomass over the course of a simulation. If this is set to true, it is best for the user to set both the root name of the slideshow and the image type.

Image files will be named with the root name first, followed by the number of the screenshot taken, then the extension.

Parameters:
b - - if true, a slideshow will be saved.
See Also:
setSlideshowName(String), setSlideshowExt(String), setSlideshowRate(int)

pauseOnStep

public boolean pauseOnStep()
Returns:
true if the simulation pauses after each cycle.

pauseOnStep

public void pauseOnStep(boolean b)
A flag for pausing the simulation after each cycle

Parameters:
b - - if true, the simulation will pause after each cycle.

true if the simulation is currently paused.

showCycleCount

public boolean showCycleCount()
Returns:
true if the simulation outputs the number of each cycle to the output panel at the end of each cycle.

showCycleCount

public void showCycleCount(boolean b)
If this flag is set to true, then after each cycle is complete, the number of the cycle completed is output to the console (a panel in the COMETS GUI or STDOUT if running the command line version)

Parameters:
b -

showCycleTime

public boolean showCycleTime()
Returns:
true if the simulation should output how long a simulation cycle took to complete, in seconds.

showCycleTime

public void showCycleTime(boolean b)
If this flag is set to true, then after each cycle is complete, the time required to finish the cycle is outputted to the console (a panel in the COMETS GUI or STDOUT in the command line version).

Parameters:
b -

isToroidalGrid

public boolean isToroidalGrid()
Returns:
true if the world is a torus - if moving off of one side just rotates back around to the other side

setToroidalGrid

public void setToroidalGrid(boolean b)
This flag sets the world to either be a torus (moving one square off the top or side moves to a similar square on the opposite side of the world) or bounded on each side.

Parameters:
b - - if true, the world is treated as a torus

public int getNumRows()
Returns:
the number of grid rows

getNumCols

public int getNumCols()
Returns:
the number of grid columns

setNumRows

public void setNumRows(int numRows)
Sets the number of rows in the grid. This must be greater than 0 - if the value passed is 0 or negative, it will be adjusted up to 1.

Parameters:
numRows - - the number of rows.

setNumCols

public void setNumCols(int numCols)
Sets the number of columns in the grid. This must be greater than 0 - if the value passed is 0 or negative, it will be adjusted to 1.

Parameters:
numCols - - the number of columns

setGridSize

public void setGridSize(int numRows,
                        int numCols)
Sets the number of rows and columns in the grid. If either of these are less than 1, they will be bumped up to 1.

Parameters:
numRows - - the number of rows in the grid
numCols - - the number of columns in the grid

getPixelScale

public int getPixelScale()
Returns:
the number of pixels on each side of a single grid space

setPixelScale

public void setPixelScale(int pixelScale)
Sets the scale of each grid space in pixels. This is expected to be at least 1, and will be adjusted up to 1 if less.

Parameters:
pixelScale -

setTimeStep

public void setTimeStep(double timeStep)
Sets the time step of each simulation in arbitrary time units. That is, the time units are dependent on whatever calculation is going on in the Model being used. For example, FBAModels use hours. This also applies to each diffusion across the world.

This should be a value between 0 and 1.

Parameters:
timeStep -

getTimeStep

public double getTimeStep()
Returns:
the time step of each simulation in arbitrary time units.
See Also:
setTimeStep(double)

true if graphics are shown in the CometsRunPanel

showGraphics

public void showGraphics(boolean b)
Sets a flag for updating graphics in the CometsRunPanel.

Parameters:
b - - if true, graphics will be updated.

allowCellOverlap

public boolean allowCellOverlap()
Returns:
true if multiple cell types (e.g. biomass from different Models) are allowed to occupy the same space.

allowCellOverlap

public void allowCellOverlap(boolean b)
Sets a flag to either allow (or disallow) biomass from multiple Models to share the same space.

Parameters:
b - - if true, different species can overlap on the same space.

getNumRunThreads

public int getNumRunThreads()
Returns:
the number of active Model simulation threads running concurrently.

setNumRunThreads

public void setNumRunThreads(int n)
Sets the number of simulation threads that can run concurrently.

Parameters:
n - - the number of threads. If this value is less than 1, it will be set to 1.

true if this is the command-line-only version of COMETS

setCommandLineOnly

public void setCommandLineOnly(boolean b)
Set COMETS to run only as a command line, or to include a GUI. See the COMETS documentation for the benefits of each.

Parameters:
b - - if true, then only a command line is running
